result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dazion K Hamilton

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dazion K Hamilton not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Dazion K Hamilton.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a bail bond hearing. Defendant's appearance is waived. Defense advised the court that the bail is appropriately set on this matter. Bail motion was not address on this case. Case remains calendared for Final Pretrial on November 8, 2022 at 8:30am in Branch 11.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing  ( 15 pages) commencing 07-26-2022 by Debra A. Wisniewski.

Defendant Dazion K Hamilton not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Dazion K Hamilton.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for further proceedings. Defendant's appearance is waived. Court addresses the speedy trial demand. Trial date falls outside of the time frame. Court vacates the scheduled final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case remains in trial posture and is placed on the trial calendar. Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed. Case remains calendared for bail bond hearing on October 4, 2022 at 8:30am in Branch 11.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Exp: 12.27.22
Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Dazion K Hamilton not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Dazion K Hamilton.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson for Samuel E Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense requested final pretrial, jury trial, and bail review dates. Court granted defense request. Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial, jury trial, and bail review in Branch 11. Any motions to be filed within 15 days from today's date; motion in limine to be filed 48 hours prior to final pretrial. Final pretrial documents to be filed prior to final pretrial date. Bail/Bond Review scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am. Final pre-trial scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 08:30 am. Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Parties are advised that due to the defendants lower pending matter 22CF61 this matter will be reassigned to Judge Franke.

Defendant Dazion K Hamilton in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen; both appear by video.  Defendant Dazion K Hamilton in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Gallert. Court took judicial notice of 22CF61. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.      
Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 608 Courthouse.
Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dazion K Hamilton in court with attorney Jorge L. Fuentes.  Defendant Dazion K Hamilton in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dazion K Hamilton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Due to co-defendant's lower pending case Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with MJM
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
